prefers that you direct link to this transcript rather than post it on your site, but you can post it on your site if you really want, as long as you keep everything intact, this includes the link to buffyworld.com and this writing. Please also keep the disclaimers intact.
Previously on Buffy the Vampire Slayer

character:
1EXT.WOODS SOMEWHERE IN SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Warren is strung up between a pair of trees. He is tied at four points, splayed out like the famous DaVinci diagram. Willow, in full dark magic splendor (black hair, black eyes), motions her hand toward Warren, and with a twist of her wrist, removes his skin. Warren screams in agony.
dialogue:
2EXT.ENGLISH COUNTRYSIDE - DAY
Giles is riding a horse through a field. Then he and Willow are talking in front of the manor.
I killed people, Giles.
I've not forgotten.
When you brought me here, I thought it was to kill me. Instead, you go all Dumbledore on me.

character:
3INT.MANOR IN ENGLISH COUNTRYSIDE - DAY
Willow is sitting on a suitcase in an exterior doorway, talking to Giles who is leaning on the doorjamb. The countryside is in the background outside the manor.
dialogue:
WILLOW
I don't want to go back home just so I can screw up again.
What exactly are you afraid of?
What if I go all veiny and homicidal again? And what if—
—they won't take you back?

character:
4INT.BRONZE NIGHT CLUB - NIGHT
Buffy, Xander, Spike and Nancy have come to the club to question Anya about the worm monster that's been terrorizing Nancy.
dialogue:
XANDER
(to Anya) Did you turn this nice lady's ex into a giant worm-monster?
(to Nancy) You wish it, I dish it. I thought we were clear on this.

character:
5INT.CHAPEL AT CEMETERY - NIGHT
Lit dimly by moonlight, Buffy and Spike are talking. There is a large, simple, gothic crucifix at the front of the chapel that can be seen by looking directly down the central aisle.
dialogue:
SPIKE
It's what you wanted, right?
Tell me what happened.
Why does a man do what he mustn't? For her.
Your soul. You got your soul back.
The Start Of Episode

6INT.SUNNYDALE AIRPORT TERMINAL - NIGHT
Clock shows 9:24. Arriving passengers are exiting the gate into the waiting area. Families and friends are reunited with their loved ones. A man exits to be greeted by his wife and two daughters.
Hi. How are you doing?
Hi, honey. Good.
And how's it going with you two?
Hi, Dad.
Go on. (pushes him) See what you did?
Hey, stop acting up!
You think she'll get the sign?
Get the sign? I don't think she's gonna see the sign.
Why is it so pale?
I used yellow crayon. It was a thing from when I talked to Willow on the bluff. I hope she gets it.
Oh, tell us again what you said.
Well, I was talking from my heart and I knew Evil Willow wasn't really ready to— You were kidding.
Mm-hmm. A little bit.
We've heard the crayon speech a few times. Not that it's not great, of course.
I saved the world with talking from my mouth. My mouth saved the world.
Uh-huh. I'm getting nervous. Are you nervous?
Yeah. It's gonna be weird seeing her. What do you say to someone in this situation?
I'm gonna say "Hi, Willow."
C'mon. You're saying it's not going to be the least bit strange? We saw her kill someone. She was about to kill Dawn—
And Giles wouldn't let her leave unless she completed that whatever recovery course.
Right. (Buffy smiles guiltily. Dawn looks at Buffy) Right?
She kinda didn't finish.
She didn't finish? She didn't finish being not evil?
H-he said it was really important that she come back early and that she was doing really well and we shouldn't worry.
Guys, I just noticed something. Everyone's off the plane, so where's Willow?

7INT.SUNNYDALE AIRPORT TERMINAL - NIGHT
Clock shows 9:24. Arriving passengers are exiting the gate into the waiting area. Looks like the same passengers that exited last scene. A man exits to be greeted by his wife and two daughters.
Hi. How are you doing?
Hi, honey. Good.
And how's it going with you two?
Hi, Dad.
Go on. (pushes him) See what you did?
Hey, stop acting up!
Welcome home, me.
Opening credits and title sequence.

character:
8EXT.CONSTRUCTION SITE AT SUNNYDALE HIGH SCHOOL - NIGHT
A Teen Boy is spray-painting graffiti on a earth retention wall at the construction site where dirt has been removed below the grade . He's painting the word "Spider" when something unseen stalks him from the shadows.
dialogue:
GNARL (O.S.)
All alone. (clicks fingernails together) Are you frightened to be all alone?
(stops painting) Is somebody there?
The wind talks when you're alone. (laughs)
You better clear out, whoever you are.

9EXT.FRONT DOOR AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Willow knocks on the front door but no one answers.

10INT.KITCHEN AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Willow knocks on the outside back door, and when there's no answer she lets herself in.
Buffy? Hello?

11INT.HALL STAIRCASE AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Willow walks upstairs slowly.

12INT.BUFFY'S ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
The sign on Willow and Tara's old room says "Buffy." Willow goes into the room and looks around sadly. Buffy has moved in. Willow walks toward the window, touches it, and remembers the sound of Tara's fatal gunshot breaking the glass. She looks at Buffy's pictures and sees pictures of all their friends, except Willow herself. She picks up Buffy's day planner, which has contact info for Buffy, Xander and Dawn. A dog barks outside, and there's a noise like a front door opening. Willow drops the planner and rushes out of the room.

13INT.HALL STAIRCASE AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Willow's coming down the stairs excitedly, looking for her friends.
Dawn? Did I hear the door?

character:
14INT.LIVING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Unable to find her friends, Willow curls up on the couch to wait until they come home. She falls asleep.
dialogue: Cut to:

character:
15INT.KITCHEN AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Shot of the microwave oven: its clock says 10:41.
dialogue: Cut to:

character:
16INT.FOYER AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Buffy, Xander, and Dawn come home and enter through the front door, talking about Willow.
dialogue:
BUFFY
They absolutely put her on the plane in London.
So, she got off in Chicago when they stopped?
She could've caught a flight anywhere from there.
(crosses arms) Maybe she doubled back. Got off the plane in London after Giles left.
Well, if she's doing that—ducking Giles—then, she's evil, right?
Well, I've avoided Giles tons of times. Just meant I was lazy, not evil.
I hope you're right, because defeating Lazy Willow—probably less hard.
We should check the messages... see if she tried to reach us here.
'S a good idea.
What was that?
Upstairs.

character:
17INT.HALL STAIRCASE AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Xander, Buffy and Dawn go up the stairs to investigate.
dialogue:
XANDER
Willow, is that you?

18INT.LIVING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
A few minutes later, Buffy and Dawn come down the stairs. Xander is sitting on the couch, and they go to sit down beside him.
Definitely not up there.
She didn't leave a message.
I checked with Giles again, too. Hasn't heard from her.
Is he throwing a tasteful British wiggins?

Oh, with extra wig. He's blaming himself pretty hard, like he should've known she wasn't ready to come back. I-I kept telling him, you know, it wasn't his fault. Maybe something about us she couldn't face.
Like she didn't think we were ready to forgive her? I get that.
So Giles is blaming Giles, and we're blaming us. Is anyone gonna blame Willow? Oh, don't give me shock face. I mean, will anyone around here ever start asking for help when they need it?
Look, if Willow flipped out, it's her bad. We can only be here for her so much if she won't be, you know, here.

character:
19INT.LIVING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - DAY
Willow wakes up. She has apparently slept on the couch all night. It's morning now. She gets up and goes to the phone and dials it.
dialogue:
WILLOW
Hello. I'm calling for Giles, uh, Mr. Giles. (pause) Right. Council meeting all day. (pause) No, no, I know, he can't be reached there. Thanks. Bye.

20EXT.SUNNYDALE STREET IN FRONT OF MAGIC BOX - DAY
Willow is walking down the bustling street toward the old Magic Box storefront. It's burned and boarded up. Anya comes out the front door with a box full of salvaged items. Willow runs up to her, excited to see her.
Anya!
Anya, don't! Don't run away.
What are you doing here? I thought you were with Giles studying how to not kill people.
I just got back.
Just got back, as in you're all better, or just got back to bring about a fiery apocalypse of death.
Neither, but I-I have been studying, working real hard, and I-I'm gonna be fine.
Oh. Good. 'Cause I remember the last time you said that. I've spent a lot of time since them cleaning the debris out of my ex-livelihood. Stuff like that.
Well, yeah, I wanna help any way I can with that. I-I feel really responsible.
(walks towards her) You feel really responsible? You are really responsible!
I-I know I hurt you and—and everyone. I'm sorry.
Here's something you should know about vengeance demons: We don't group with the "sorry." We prefer "Oh, God, please stop hitting me with my own rib bones."
Go on. Say whatever you want. Rib bones and so forth. I-I deserve it.
Then you won't mind? (Willow shakes her head no) Well, then, that's no fun.
Sorry.
So, um, where is everyone these days?
Well, I'm back in my own apartment. And, of course, vengeance takes me all over the world. I was in Brazil yesterday. They love their soccer.
And the others? Dawn, and, uh, Xander, Buffy?
You haven't seen them?
Not so much.
Huh. I guess they're still mad at you. They've been a little temperamental lately, just between you and me. We had this little mix-up a few days ago, and —
That sounds great. So, um, where do you think they'd be?

Oh, at the new high school, probably. Everyone's all about the high school. Buffy's got some kind of job there helping junior deviants, Spike's insane in the basement, Xander's there doing construction on the new gym—
Wait, Spike's what in the whatment?
Insane. Base. Xander does construction. He likes to start early, so he's probably there by now.

21EXT.CONSTRUCTION SITE AT SUNNYDALE HIGH SCHOOL - DAY
Willow walks up to the edge of the pit where they're doing construction. Willow calls out over the site, looking around for Xander.
Xander? Xander, you down there?

character:
22EXT.CONSTRUCTION SITE AT SUNNYDALE HIGH SCHOOL - DAY
Zoom back up to where Willow was standing, but now there's Buffy and Xander instead.
dialogue:
BUFFY
No skin.
Tough to look at.
And yet my eyes refuse to look away. Stupid eyes.
I found it first thing this morning. I gave my crew the day off, and I called you right away.
I got to get a job where I don't get called right away for this stuff.
Yeah, I know exactly what you're thinking. Maybe Willow is back.

ACT II.

23INT.HALLWAY AT SUNNYDALE HIGH - DAY
Students are walking around in the hallways between classes. Willow is walking down the hall as well. The bell rings, and the students rush to their classes. She finds the basement door that reads "Basement. No Student Access." She opens the door and walks down the stairs into the basement.

character:
24INT.BASEMENT SUNNYDALE HIGH - DAY
Willow walks around the basement looking around. There are spare bookshelves and other classroom equipment stored there. Then Spike jumps out from out of nowhere and yells at her.
dialogue:
SPIKE
Out! This is my place. You need permission to be here. You need a special slip with a stamp.
Spike. My God... I—
(ranting, pacing) You go off and try to wall up the bad parts and put your heart back in where it fell out. You call yourself finished, but you're not. Worse than ever, you are...
You went away. You've been gone since...
I needed to go, but I'm back now. And I found... There's a body.
Tragedy. (faces Willow) Is there blood?
Uh, I, Yeah, and I can't find Buffy or Xander or Dawn. And there's this thing killing people. And the victim was... skinned. What could do that?
You did it once. I heard about it.
Anything other—other than me?
Look at you... glowing. What's a word means "glowing"? Gotta rhyme.
Spike?
Oh, ah, no. I-I-I should hide. Hide from you. Hide my face. You know what I did.
What you did? You didn't do anything... did you?
Everyone's talking to me. No one's talking to each other.
Spike, please try to listen to me.
Someone isn't here. Button, button... who's got the button? My money's on (stops and faces Willow) the witch.

25INT.BASEMENT SUNNYDALE HIGH - DAY
Xander and Buffy are walking together in the basement, talking.
We can't use the blueprints to find our way around down here. It's like the walls move or something.
Out! This is my place.
(to Xander) I think I hear him.
You need permission to be here. You need a special slip with a stamp.
(ranting, pacing) ... and put your heart back in where it fell out. You call yourself finished, but you're not. Worse than ever, you are...
Spike. Spike.
You went away. You've been gone since...
The church. You scared me a little. I didn't—I didn't know what to think.
We're here for a reason, Spike.
Tragedy. (faces right, away from Xander and Buffy) Is there blood?
He knows. He must have seen the body.
You did it once. I heard about it.
Spike, we need to know who did this.
Look at you... glowing. What's a word means "glowing"? Gotta rhyme.
Spike, please...
I-I-I should hide. Hide from you. Hide my face. You know what I did.
Boy, he's extra-useful today.
(whispering to Xander) This isn't the time.
Everyone's talking to me. No one's talking to each other.
(to Xander) Might as well go.
Someone isn't here. Button, button... who's got the button? My money's on (stops and faces his right) the witch.
Red's a bad girl.
He's talking about Willow.
And that means something because he's chock-full-o-sanity.
Maybe he saw her.
They think you did it. The slayer and her boy. They think you took the skin.
Is there something here? Something that killed?
(offended) Her boy? I'm her boy?
I have to go. There are things here without permission. I have to check their slips. Make sure they have authorization.

26INT.ANYA'S APARTMENT - DAY
Willow knocks on Anya's door. Anya opens it.
I need help.
I don't have any money.
I don't want money.
Come in. Enjoy my personal space. (shuts door)
I found a dead body near the high school.
Yes, that can happen.
Something horrible killed a boy. Took his skin right off.
Was it you? (shocked) No.
Well with the skin thing, they're definitely going to think it was you. Buffy is, anyway.
Yeah. I mean maybe she already does. I don't know. I just—I-I have to find whatever did this. I just—I need to do something right.

Oh, and so they'll think it wasn't you, right? I mean, that has to be part of it. Maybe you're even thinking you kill this thing, they don't even have to know about it. Won't suspect you, even for a minute.
No, I-I don't— When did you get all insightful?
I'm surprisingly sensitive.
So, will you help me?
(sighs) Is it difficult or time-consuming?

27INT.ANYA'S APARTMENT - DAY
Now the curtains in Anya's apartment are closed, blocking the sunlight. Candles are lit and she and Willow are sitting on the floor, Indian-style, facing each other, with a map of Sunnydale between them.
This isn't going to get all sexy, is it?
I'd be shocked. OK, do you have your powder?
Oh, I ate that. I have it.
OK, we scatter it over the map, and everywhere there's a demon, a little light appears.
Oh, pretty! Will it hurt the carpet?
No. (pauses to clear her thoughts) OK, scatter.
Oh!
Hey look—that's me! Hello. What's that huge clump?
It's the high school. It's all hellmouthy is underneath.
Things have been stirring there lately. Is it getting brighter?
Smoke!
Ah! OK. Remember our talk about the carpet?
Thi-this could be it. It's strong, it's near the body, and it's all by itself, hiding in the woods or-or maybe cave. There are a couple of good caves around there.
I don't know. Sounds pretty thin to me.
Well, that's why you teleport over there real quick like a bunn—real quick and, uh, see if I'm right.
No. Sorry. You damaged my carpet.
Anya, you're a vengeance demon. Just teleport!

Well, as it turns out, teleporting isn't a right, it's a privilege. I withdrew a vengeance spell last week, and this is my punishment. I can only teleport for official business. I have to file a flight plan and everything.
Oh. I'm sorry. That must be hard.
Yeah, it bites a pretty big one. And the vengeance itself, i-it's not as fulfilling as I remember.
Really? 'Cause I got the impression that you enjoyed—you know, inflicting.
Well, causing pain sounds really cool, I know, but turns out it's really upsetting. Didn't use to be, but now it is.
Is it like you're scared of losing that feeling again. And that having it be OK to hurt people. And then you're not in charge of the power anymore because it's in charge of you?
Wow, that was really over-dramatically stated, but, yeah, that's it.
I get it. Believe me.
(sincerely) I'm sorry, Willow. I wish it were better for you.
You too.
It did get a little sexy, didn't it?
(nods, then catches herself, walks away quickly) I have to find this monster.
(holding candles now) Willow... um, isn't there another spell? I mean, you're trying to find Buffy and Xander. Couldn't we use a spell to do that?
I did. I-I tried, and something went kaflooey, and it didn't work.
What did it say?
It said they don't exist.

28INT.DINING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - DAY
Dawn, Buffy, and Xander are sitting around the dining room table doing research. Buffy has several books open in front of her, while Dawn is surfing the Internet on her laptop. Xander has a book in his lap.

OK, so I looked up demons that skin their victims and demons that flay their victims 'cause, you know, same thing. There's a ton of prospects. Anything else gone? Uh, eyeballs, toenails or viscera? That's guts.
She knows about viscera. Makes you proud.
Just skin.
OK, I'll work on that.
What's up?
I need to do something. I just—I have this feeling in my gut—
In your viscera!
—that we know exactly who did this. And all of this work that we're doing is just a way for us to convince ourselves that Willow's OK.

Oh, guys! (gesturing them to come over to her) I got a good one. A demon called "Gnarl." He's a parasite with these nasty long fingernails. He secretes something through them and uses that to paralyze his victims. He then cuts strips of their skin while they're still alive. It takes hours.
We didn't find any strips of skin. Which, by the way, (shudders) gghhhh!
You wouldn't. He eats them. That's why he's a parasite. It's like his natural food.
Dawn, you're new at this, and I get why you're proud, but I'm not exactly sure why this demon is any more likely than any of the others.
You never said pool of blood.
There was no pool, just splatters.
(smiling) Then this is your guy. He laps up the blood. You could say it's like his natural beverage.
(points at Dawn) You're terrifying.
Now if we just knew how to find this thing.
Well, we could ask some questions over at Willy's place.
Or, we could be smart. Sorry, Xander.
What?
W-whoever did this had to get blood on them, which means they left a trail.
Right, minute traces of blood.
And we have a way to track it.
We have a— Oh, I get it.
What? How? What's going on?

29EXT.WOODS NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Spike's walking around, mumbling to himself.
William's a good boy. Carries her water, carries her sin. Supposed to     get easier, isn't it. Supposed to help to help, but it doesn't. Still so heavy.
Should've put a leash on him.
Yes, let's tie ourselves to the crazy vampire.
You really think it's gonna work?
It's pretty easy. Spike follows the exciting smell of blood, and we follow the fairly ripe smell of Spike.

It's smellementary. Also, I'm sure there's tons of stuff like this. You know, procedures we can use that don't involve magic spells. Just good solid detective work. And we can develop a database of tooth impressions and demon skin samples and I could wear high heels more often.
Wow, that was so close to being empowered.
Everybody loves a slender ankle.
That's it. End of the line. Everyone off. (turns to Xander) Keep your ticket, you'll need that.
That's a rock cliff.
Well, give him a break, Buffy. Maybe it's a vicious skin-eating rock cliff.
There's a cave in it. Look. (pushes the bush aside) I'm insane. What's his excuse?

30EXT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Willow's standing at the entrance to the cave. She decides to go in.

31INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Willow squeezes through the narrow opening on her belly. The cave seems empty at first, even though there is light from a fire. There's some noises, and then something speaks to her.
All alone.

32EXT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Buffy, Dawn, and Xander are standing at the entrance to the cave. They decide to go in.

33INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Buffy, Dawn, and Xander are standing inside the cave now. The cave seems empty at first, even though there is light from a fire.
Dark and dank. I was hoping it'd be dark and dank.
Shh! Do you hear that?
No, I don't. But now I do.
Something's moving in here.
Guess we're in the right place.

34INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Willow is standing still, looking around to see what's there, who's talking to her.
Look at the shorn lamb. See how he trembles. Is it the cold wind? Or is it that the flock is nowhere to be seen?
Poor little lamb all alone.
You guys hear that, right?
Yep.
It's echoing. I know it sounds close, but I don't think—
Dawn! Are you OK?
I guess so. (sounds weak, uncovers her stomach to show a large gash across it) Poison paralyzes.
Dawn. OK, we need to get her out of here. We'll deal with him later. Seal him in.

35INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Willow is still standing still, still looking around to see what's there, who's talking to her. She's scared now. Rocks are appearing at the cave opening, sealing her in. Willow turns to investigate.
What's going on? Who's there? No! Stop!
(cackling) Ha ha ha!

ACT III.

36INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Resume.
No way out now. No way out.
Protect me, Goddess. In thy name, I supplicate myself. Take the powers from my enemy, and lay him lower than the lowest field.
Gnarl loves spells. He keeps them as pets. They love him. And they leave him alone. (laughs)
You may be immune to magic, but I've got more than that. You wanna fight?
Your friends left you here. (singing) No one comes to save you. (talking) They wanted me to have you.

37EXT.WOODS NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Xander and Buffy carry Dawn between them, with one of her arms around each of their necks.
The computer. That thing Dawn was reading might have an antidote for the paralysis.
(without moving her lips) Um, Buffy?
What?
I'm really sorry.
Oh, it's OK.
You couldn't help it. It had paralyzing fingernails.
Just like you said it would, so good on you.

38INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Willow's looking around trying to find her pursuer.
Did they leave you as a gifty for me? Are you a tasty little gifty?
Stop it!
Or did they just throw you away?
Were they here? Were my friends really here? I heard something.
(in pain) Ah, ah...

They were here. Here they were. And there they went. (singing) Gone, all gone, what a pretty song. (talking) They sealed you in with me. (grabs her ankle and pulls her toward him) I love a gifty. (squats over her) Can't wait to unwrap it. (clicks nails)

39INT.FOYER AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT - NIGHT
Buffy and Xander carry Dawn in hastily through the front door. Dawn's horizontal now, being carried like a roll of carpet.
OK, watch—watch the head.
Gotcha.
(without moving mouth) Watch my head. Watch my head!

character:
40INT.LIVING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Xander and Buffy walk toward the sofa with Dawn.
dialogue:
XANDER
Sofa.
(without moving mouth) Face up! Face up!
(rolling her over) She's right, face up is better.
(sighs) OK, I'm gonna check the computer. Find that page. See if there's an antidote.
It'll be all right. We'll get you fixed up. You'll be doing limbo in no time.
Yeah, as a pole.
No, not as a pole. I promise.

41INT.DINING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Buffy is sitting at the laptop that's on the dining room table.
Oh, got it. It says the paralysis is permanent. (Dawn squeaks) No, oh, wait, my bad. (reading) Permanent until the creature dies. (looks over) Sorry.

character:
42INT.LIVING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Xander is kneeling beside Dawn, holding her hand as she is laid out paralyzed on the couch.
dialogue:
BUFFY
Guess we have to go back.
We can't just leave her here like this. What if she vomits?
(without moving mouth) Ew. I won't vomit.
Do you think she'll vomit?
(without moving mouth) Stop talking about vomit.
I'll call Anya. She can watch her.
Right, she'll love being called for vomit watch.
(without moving mouth) Stop talking about vomit.

43INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Gnarl is still squatting over Willow, playing with her stomach with his fingernail.

Gnarl makes a pretty picture. (scratches her again) It's easy when you know how. It's easy when everyone helps. They helped me. (licks her blood off his fingernail) Too bad there's no one to help you.

44INT.LIVING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Anya has arrived to look after Dawn. Buffy and Xander are getting ready to fight Gnarl.
I bet she's dying.
She's not dying. She's just paralyzed.
Oh. Paralyzed how?
Paralyzed how? In the not moving way.
Well, there's lots of different ways. Did you try this?
Hey!
(without moving her lips) Hey!
Oh! You're poseable.
She's poseable?
It's a common variety. Watch this.
Huh. Neat as you please. Hardly a need to undo her.
(mouthful of nuts) Where'd you get the nuts?
Brazil. No need to thank me, by the way, for sitting with her. I'm feeling very benevolent today. Helping Willow. Helping you. You might even call it even for that whole worm thing last week.
Yeah, I don't think we could call— Wait, you saw Willow?
Um-hmm. Oh, she's looking for you, by the way. Decided you might be out in some cave. Sounded pretty tenuous.
(without moving her lips) Cave?
Anya, listen. This is really important. Did Willow go to that cave?
Mm-hmm. Last time I saw her, that's where she was headed. (turning to Dawn) Shall I make her salute? That'd be very cute.
Xander, she could be there right now. Willow could be trapped with the Gnarl.
(playing with Dawn's hand) Uh, it's not "The Gnarl", just "Gnarl". Oh, wouldn't it be tragic if you were here being kinda silly with your comically paralyzed sister while Willow was dying?
Anya, you know about this creature?
Uh-huh, sure.
You're coming with us.

45INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Willow's still lying on the ground, paralyzed, crying, and in pain. She's trying to talk.
(without moving her mouth) They wouldn't leave. They'll return.

(laughing) They don't want you. (singing) Lock you in, nice white skin... (talking) And if they do return, where will the find you? Inside me, you'll already be. (cutting a new piece of skin from her belly) Aww... love it.

ACT IV.

46EXT.WOODS NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Xander, Buffy, and Anya are running back to the cave. Anya's lagging behind.
Anya, you gotta keep up.
Uhhh! I'm out of shape. I've been teleporting for months.
Hurry!

47INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Willow is lying on the ground. Gnarl is still squatting over her.
(without moving her mouth) No, no, no...
What's going on? Where's Willow?
She's right here. Can't you see her? She's hurt!
What? Where? (feels around with his hand) There's nothing here.
Your hand—it's going right through her. (to Buffy) What's going on?
I don't know, but I'm starting to get why we haven't seen her.
Because we haven't seen her.
I have this feeling that whatever's causing this invisible thing is a whole separate issue from the skin-eating monster.
Behind you!
Close one.
Remember what I said. Get him in the eyes. (kneels beside Willow) Willow, I'm here. Wow, you're really hurt.
(without moving her mouth) What's going on?
Buffy's fighting the demon over there, see. But if they get too close, I'm gonna have to run.
(without moving her mouth) I don't see.
But they're here. Buffy and Xander.
(without moving her mouth) They came? They didn't leave me?
No, they didn't leave you. They can't see you.
(without moving her mouth) They're here. They're here. I'm not alone.
Good. You're doing really good.
(to Buffy) Ew. Ew. Thumbs? I can't believe you did that.
(to Willow) Oh, Buffy killed the demon. It was gross.
I can... I can move. Oh...

48INT.LIVING ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - NIGHT
Dawn can move now too. She falls over and squeaks when the paralysis ends.

49INT.CAVE NEAR SUNNYDALE - NIGHT
Buffy runs to where Anya and Xander are, but Buffy and Xander still can't see Willow.
Willow? Are you here?
Where is she? Is she alive?
She's right here. OK, stand back. You're getting your feet in her.
Willow?
She's hurt really bad, you guys. I'm gonna go get help.
I think she's sort of (gesturing) here-ish.
Willow? W-we can't exactly see you, but we're really glad that you're back. I-I don't know how badly you're hurt, but—
Is that Willow?
—I couldn't find you guys and I looked everywhere. And the demon said that you left me and— Oh, there you are. There you are! Don't go away.
We're not going away. (sees her wounds) Oh, God.
It's gonna be OK, Willow. You're gonna be OK.
I know. You're here.

50INT.WILLOW'S ROOM AT BUFFY'S HOUSE - DAY
Willow's sitting on the bed in pajamas in Buffy's old bedroom, meditating. Buffy walks up to the doorway, sees her, and decides not to interrupt her. Willow opens her eyes.
Buffy...
Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to interrupt.
That's all I had left in me anyway.
I didn't realize meditating was such hard work.
I'm healing. Growing new skin.
(walks toward Willow) Wow. That's magic, right? I mean, when most people when they meditate don't get extra skin, right. 'Cause Clem should, like, cut back. (sits on edge of bed)
It's magic. I'm drawing power from the earth to heal myself.
We're on the second floor.
(laughs) You know Giles says everything's part of the earth. This bed. The air. Us.
Explains why my fingernails get dirty even when I don't do anything.
Plus you stuck your thumbs in a demon.
True.
You're wiped out. I-I should go.
No. Please stay. I missed you so much when I couldn't find you.
We missed you too. I missed you. Dawn's, uh, working on what caused the mutual no-see-ums, but so far we haven't—
I did it.
You did a spell?
I didn't mean to. I-I just remember thinking I wasn't ready to see you guys yet. I was afraid we wouldn't, you know, connect.
So, you made it happen just by thinking it?
Guess I have a ways to go before I master my powers, huh?
It's OK. As long as you're all right.
It's nice to be forgiven. Too bad I need so much of it.
I have a confession to make. I thought it might be you. With the flaying.
I know.
I wanna be the kind of person that wouldn't think that. Xander never thought it.

He did, a little. Heck, I did a little. Xander has the luxury of not saying it, but you're the slayer. You have to say stuff like that. It's OK. It's OK too if you still don't think I can recover from this magic stuff, 'cause, honestly, I'm not that sure about it either.
I thought you were too tired.
It hurts too much not to try.
I'm sorry.
It just takes so much strength. I don't have that much.
I got so much strength, I'm giving it away.
Are you sure?
Will it help?
Much.
Good.
